what: Sample Next Health State Based on Transition Probabilities — sampleV
title: Sample Next Health State Based on Transition Probabilities — sampleV
text: function determines next health state individuals based matrix transition probabilities. samples random value individual assigns new state using cumulative transition probabilities.

title: Sample Next Health State Based on Transition Probabilities — sampleV
Sample Next Health State Based on Transition Probabilities — sampleV
text: m_trans_probs numeric matrix transition probabilities row represents individual's transition probabilities across states. v_states_names character vector state names corresponding columns m_trans_probs.

title: Sample Next Health State Based on Transition Probabilities — sampleV
text: character vector indicating health state individual transitions next cycle.

title: Sample Next Health State Based on Transition Probabilities — sampleV
code: # Define a transition probability matrix (3 individuals, 3 states) m_trans_probs <- matrix(c(0.7, 0.2, 0.1,                           0.6, 0.3, 0.1,                           0.5, 0.4, 0.1),                         nrow = 3, byrow = TRUE) v_states_names <- c("Healthy", "Diseased", "Dead")  # Sample next states sampleV(m_trans_probs, v_states_names) #> [1] "Healthy"  "Diseased" "Diseased"
